alert.note: Alert for Elliott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 6:17PM EST until March 06 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Elliott, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, Owingsville, Sandy Hook, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Salt Lick, Yale, Cogswell, Young Springs, Farmers, Midland, Freestone, Zilpo, Bluestone, Bangor, Sudith, Brandy and Polksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
